title: How to communicate without a phone - Quora

response.answer_text: Supplies you'll need… Pen/pencil/crayon Paper Envelope A stamp The ability to write a word/sentence You sit in a quiet place and you begin writing what was known in the “old days” as writing a letter to someone.  Some individuals would start out with the word “Dear….” and would write the recipients name and a comma after the word “Dear”….. ex:. “Dear Homer,” Then you would write what it is that you are needing/wanting to communicate to “Homer” or the name of the person that you are writing to. Once you are finished with your letter, you will put it in the envelope and write the address to the person you are sending it to and you will lick the envelope and put a stamp on it …TIP: “MAKE SURE YOU HAVE THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF POSTAGE ON IT OR IT WON'T GET MAILED”…Once you have completed all of these steps then you will either put it in your mailbox with the flag up OR you will take it to the post office and put it in the “outgoing mail” box!! Much more personable this way….If you need further assistance with this, go to your local elementary school and see if you can sit in on the 3rd grade class when the teacher has it scheduled to go over this. Thanks and have a fantastic day!!!

Mobile phone is very important for everybody nowadays. I can’t imagine how can we communicate without a mobile phone. If the world has not mobile phone any more, people have a lot of ways to communicate together, I think. We can write a letter that is so easy and cheap to send. Another way to get in touch with others people is requested to meet around town at your favorite locations. I guess you will feel relaxing to talk and enjoy the atmosphere. Finally, you can connect to the others by using your computer which has many apps like video chat or snap chat. Life would be better without mobile phone.

“Communication means imparting or interchange of thoughts, opinions, or information by speech, writing, or signs.” the definition of communication Just use a computer or a tablet. Social media. Email. Fax. Facetime. Call. Text. If you are looking for the forms of communication that are not online: Talk with someone in person. One of the most important things in communication is listening and understanding what they are saying to you. Sign Language. Morse Code. Write a letter to them. Even your facial expressions can be a form of commuicating your emotions.

Well, if you happen to know where he lives, then you can write him a letter. Letters are quite easy and cheap to send, and it’s always nice to receive something in the mail. Alternatively, you could both use an e-mail account to exchange e-mails. They’re faster than hand-written letters and free, and your provider stores e-mails forever (for the most part). You could also request to meet around town at your favorite locations, and spend a free afternoon just talking and enjoying the atmosphere. If you’re in school, find some time between classes to say hi, or take some time out right after to catch up. Perhaps you can invite him over, or visit him at his home to chat over a cup of tea, or go for a walk and talk. Beyond that, I cannot really think of much else with such little details provided, but I hope that my answer provides some insightful ideas!

Well, you can be honest about the phone situation and ask him if he would be open to emails. You can use library computers and internet or if you have a computer, without internet, a lot of libraries rent hotspots you could use to get internet. A computer with internet means you can video chat or snapchat.

My solutions are to speak to the other in person. If that's not possible, then long, personal letters with lots of details about what's going on in your daily life are always welcome by the recipient. Shorter notes are good as well. Please be sure to buy decent stationery, if it's within your budget.
Bicycle courier, mail, megaphone, smoke signals, ham radio, Morse code, body language, hand written notes delivered by messenger. This is just the short list.
